title: Why is technical writing so important? - Quora

response.answer_text: In like manner, Technical reports are of much significance as they collaborate reliable information for software developers, to help them to provide explicit support for their customers. Mainly, Technical documentation involves enriched information about the product being developed and this, in fact, would anticipate searching, finding and offering solutions to customer queries. Technical reports are much important as it helps users to quickly learn about the product with its stored information and promotes explicit customer experience. Let me mention here a few aspects for why technical writing considered as much important. In Day-to-Day business activities, technical writing involves reports generation as is the key aspect in the development and application of technology. In the aspect of management, reports generation are important on the viability of design, costs, and work objectives which would include process maps, procedures, etc.The technical writing involves Documentation used for training purpose in the form of scripts, articles, eBooks, white papers, and degree theses.Also, technical writing includes the user manuals, instructions, and procedures, etc, and these forms of specialized writing could be well done by Trained Technical writers as these documents contain legal/liability implications.Another important aspect is technical writing also involves about Patents information, usually written by Lawyers and mainly addresses the inventor’s part of a patent application and the general criteria for patent ability.Obviously, we could understand that Technical writing is of much significance as its motive is to deliver accurate and useful information to the end user. In this instance, to have a versatile, responsive and accessible Technical Documentation, it is best to use a knowledge base software such as Document360 that could scale with your product.

Joe Devney has given a pretty good answer. I agree with everything he mentioned. To his list, I’d like to add one more and equally important reason why good technical writing is important: preventing chaos. One famous case is what happened when two different teams working on the Mars orbiter could not get their measuring units right: “NASA lost a $125 million Mars orbiter because a Lockheed Martin engineering team used English units of measurement while the agency's team used the more conventional metric system for a key spacecraft operation…” Click here for the whole story As a professional tech writer, from time to time I truly feel I’m one of the few people standing between order and chaos :-) Besides of course helping us put food on the table, technical writing is also a profession that contributes to smooth and orderly flow of daily life by offering reliable solutions to technical problems.
